section.section:
Of the 7 members of the Board:
5 shall be licensed architects; and
2 shall be consumer members.
The Governor shall appoint the members with the advice of the Secretary and the advice and consent of the Senate.

text.section: Each member of the Board shall be a resident and citizen of the State.

Of the 5 architect members of the Board:
at least 3 shall be graduates of schools of architecture accredited by the National Architectural Accrediting Board; and
each shall have practiced architecture in the State, in private practice as a primary vocation, for at least 10 years before appointment.

While a member of the Board, a consumer member may not:
have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Board; or
grade any examination given by or for the Board.
Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 5 years and begins on July 1.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 1989.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
